name: Snackpass
headline: Order ahead at restaurants and get rewards with friends.
description:
Skip the line, collect points and send gifts to friends 🎁
Snackpass is an app that makes ordering food more convenient, affordable and social.

founders.name: Jamie Marshall, Founder
founders.description:
Social meets pickup. Order ahead and get rewards with friends at your favorite restaurants ✨

Cofounder/COO 
Thiel Fellow
Forbes 30u30

founders.name: Kevin Tan, Founder/CEO
founders.description: Building the future of social commerce, starting with restaurant takeout.

generated_description:
Snackpass is a vibrant startup founded in 2017 and a proud member of Y Combinator's W18 batch. Nestled in the heart of San Francisco, this innovative company has a mission that resonates with food lovers: order ahead at restaurants and earn rewards, especially when you bring your friends along. 

The app, which initially aimed to let users skip the line and send gifts to friends, has evolved into a modern point of sale (POS) system tailored for the next generation of dining experiences. With about 38 employees, Snackpass continues to make food ordering not just easier, but also more social and rewarding. 

One of the key figures behind Snackpass is Michael Seibel, the Group Partner at Y Combinator. The company positions itself within the marketplace and e-commerce sectors of the bustling San Francisco Bay Area. By offering a seamless experience for both customers and restaurant operators, Snackpass has become a favorite among a wide variety of food brands—from popular boba shops to burrito outlets.

What sets Snackpass apart is its focus on customer loyalty. Users earn points every time they order, whether in-store, online, or through the app. This consistency encourages repeat visits and boosts brand loyalty for participating restaurants.

It isn’t just the customers who are raving. Business owners have reported significant improvements in operational efficiency after partnering with Snackpass, eliminating the hassle of juggling multiple systems. With tools like kiosks for self-ordering and a comprehensive analytics dashboard, Snackpass is redefining how restaurants engage with their patrons.

As the food delivery landscape continues to evolve, Snackpass positions itself as a future-proof solution, ensuring that restaurants stay competitive without hefty investments. Interested in learning more? You can explore their story and offerings on their website, [Snackpass](https://snackpass.co).

That's the essence of Snackpass: making food ordering a community experience while helping restaurants thrive in an increasingly digital world.
